script: the Turkish sultan enslaved 1,000 Transylvanian boys to fill the ranks of his army.
These child slaves were beaten without mercy– trained to kill without conscience, to crave the blood of all who defied the Turks.
From among these boys, one grew into a warrior so fierce that entire armies would retreat in terror at the mention of his name– Vlad the Impaler.
Sickened by his monstrous acts, Vlad came to bury his past with the dead and returned to Transylvania to rule in peace.
But the world would come to know him as Dracula.
I left it where I found it.
What the hell’s a lone Turk doing out here?
And whatever they scout, they conquer.
Dumitru, I need you to return to the castle.
Alert the guards and double the sentry.
What? I’m not leaving you here.
For the Turks to cross into my land is a sign of war.
What are you going to do?
I’ll do what princes do best– negotiate.
Bats don’t come out during the day.
The creature you encountered was no accident, my prince.
Four nights ago, every brother in our order awoke from an identical dream.
I would not have thought it possible had I not suffered the same vision myself that night– of a creature laying siege to this holy place.
The Roman mystics prophesized the coming of a great evil– a vampire.
From the Greek word pi– to drink.
The beast was once a mortal man who summoned a demon from the depths of hell to trade for his dark power.
The demon tricked the man, granting his wish, but his price was an eternity condemned to the darkness of that cave where he remains until he finds another to set him free.
Now you know its true face.
The people of Transylvania live in enough fear of the Turks’ return.
Promise me you’ll guard this secret, brother.
What, an embrace but no kiss?
Something troubles you. What is it?
Only the impossible depth of your beauty.
Puts the rest of the world to shame.
Pay no attention to your father, Ingeras.
Flattery is a cheap distraction from truth.
It’s one of your most endearing qualities.
You’re just in time for bed.
-Can we go riding tomorrow, Papa? -Of course we can.
Because tomorrow is the day of our risen Lord.
All I know is that I’ve lost two good men today.
I was the same age as Ingeras when I was sent to live with the Turks.
If I never saw another, it would be too soon.
For almost as many years as you were gone.
Ten years of peace and prosperity ever since our prince came back to us.
My old friend, here’s to 20 more.
We were not expecting you so soon.
Sultan Mehmed II offers his salutations to you and your son.
Thank him. I have his tribute ready.
I’m afraid there’s something more than a tribute to discuss.
The Turks have no enemies here.
Did you think we would not notice a battalion of our scouts missing?
Locked in a dark cage, hidden away.
But you and I... we both know it’s there.
The sultan requires 1,000 boys to join his Janissary Corps.
He ended that practice years ago.
When a soldier is plucked as a child and raised to know no other life, they will kill without question and die without complaint.
Any who are 15 years of age or older will fight in Hungary.
Those 10 to 14 will be made ready for the siege on Vienna.
After all, did not your own father give you up without a fight?
You have no army and no choice, Prince.
Follow our command, or suffer the consequences.
Courage, anger, even love– none of these can matter to a prince.
All that matters is his duty to his people.
INGERAS: What does it mean to be a royal hostage?
My father gave me to the sultan to prove his loyalty.
Were you scared there? With them.
I wanted to make my father proud.
Would you ever give me to the sultan?
That was a long time ago.
You have nothing to worry about.
they’ll kill a hundred for every one I save.
You told me you and Mehmed were once like brothers.
Were you to ask, isn’t it possible he might show you some mercy?
You ever see the like of it?
Soon the entire world will be Turk.
All I miss from my time with you is the coffee.
It’s true. My father’s palace was a cruel place for a young boy far from home.
But soon you talked like us, prayed like us, fought like us.
Speaking of which, I am owed 1,000 boys.
Why have I not seen them?
Mehmed, my brother, I will grant you anything else.
I’m worth a thousand boys, and you know it.
Those kings would tremble if they knew.
When we were boys, how I longed to fight side by side.
But now I am sultan, what need have I for one more soldier?
I will have my thousand boys.
Your son will be raised under my roof just as you were raised under the roof of my father.
But General Ismail will remain to see that my orders are fulfilled.
If you are virile, you will make plenty more.
You promised me this would never happen.
The day you asked for my hand, remember what I said?
You said things would be different.
You said if I loved you, I should trust you.
Everything’s fine, boys. They’re just saying their good-byes.
Come, Mirena. I won’t let you– You promised me and my family!
I won’t. I won’t let them do this.
The prince is doing– No, I won’t let you do this!
You’re proud of me, aren’t you?
Yeah, I have to say we are a little disappointed.
Frankly, I expected more resistance from you.
Mehmed will punish all of Transylvania for what you have done.
It’s not a child’s place to save his country.
Get my family to the castle.
Whatever haunts Broken Tooth, I know it kills Turks. Hyah!
It seems no one has ever had the privilege of leaving either.
Those who enter reek of fear.
What kind of man crawls into his own grave in search of hope? Hmm?
The Turks threaten to destroy my kingdom.
With power like yours, I could stop them.
Save my people. Save my family.
House Dracul. Son of the devil.
It means son of the dragon.
Do your people know how many innocents you have killed?
Lie to me again, and I’ll open you from your belly to your brain and feed you your intestines.
And when you put them to the stake, what did you feel?
A greater crime than the act itself.
Then why spill blood if not for the pleasure of it?
Because men do not fear swords.
By putting one village to the stake, I spared 10 more.
Sometimes the world no longer needs a hero.
Sometimes what it needs is a monster.
And you believe you know what it is to be a monster? Hmm?
But I’m going to show you.
For centuries, these moldering walls have been my gallows.
For I’m bound to this cave, condemned by one who turned me.
Oh, and I have waited an eternity for a man of your strength, your gifts, your will– a man worthy of the dark and all its powers.
For if I am your salvation, you are mine.
Drink. You will have a taste of my power.
The strength of a hundred men.
The speed of a falling star.
Dominion over the night and all its creatures.
To see and hear through their senses.
Once you drink, your thirst for human blood will be insatiable.
But if you can resist for three days, you will return to your mortal state, having sampled my power and perhaps saved your people.
The price would be worse than if you’d never stepped in here.
For I will be set free, having granted the darkness a worthy offering.
You will become its vessel, as I am, a scourge on this earth destined to destroy everything you hold dear– your land, your people, even your precious wife and son.
I would die before I’d harm them.
I, however, will at last be free to unleash my wrath against the one who betrayed me.
And one day I will call on you to serve me, my pawn, in an immortal game of revenge.
-This is not a game! -Ah, what better way to endure eternity.
For this, little prince, is the ultimate game.
And all the world’s fate hangs in the balance.
Then it will be my great pleasure to disappoint you.
Searching for the strength I needed.
A good prince would have given them up.
A good prince would have paid that price for peace.
They’ve brought war to our land!
And they will pay dearly for it.
Do not ask me what happened on this field tonight.
Trust only that I will use all I have to keep us safe.
But we will not be safe if we stay here.
We must leave directly for Cozia monastery.
It’s high in the mountains, too remote for cannon fire.
It’s our best chance of survival.
We’ll take enough of our people so that our absence is noticed.
That way, when Mehmed learns what has happened here, he’ll come hunting for us.
Vlad has defeated a thousand of our men.
When I march into Europe, I will have his head upon my spear and his child at my side.
Use the forests, the mountains around the Borgó Pass.
Four or five months of that.
I’m going to win this war in three days.
Why not two– and really impress us?
Don’t think I haven’t noticed you following me.
They recognize one of their own.
The night is their kingdom, blood their sustenance.
And some, they say, have lived for as long as there have been prey to devour.
They say the one who escaped the mountain hides behind the face of a man.
Well, if that man is me, you’ll know a knife will not do you any good.
Why do you think I stayed?
I know there is only so far on this earth we can run, and it is not far enough.
We found him in the field. He asked for you.
He hopes you enjoy the view.
I’m the thing men fear on Broken Tooth.
May God strike down whoever did this to you.
This is the strength you sought?
Because I sent corpses back to Mehmed instead of our son.
In two days, I’ll be restored.
And if you were to give in?
Then I become this for eternity.
You will undo this, won’t you?
I swear it. I will not give in.
Mehmed is getting closer. We might want to move out soon.
I need you to get to the monastery as quickly as you can.
Mehmed’s men will be close by.
I will reach you after sundown.
My husband agrees with your counsel.
We will depart now under your temporary command.
What? And where’s Vlad going to be?
Spying on the Turks. He insists on doing his own reconnaissance.
Tell the sultan where his enemies will be buried.
Couldn’t these monks build their gates a little bit closer?
Don’t the Turks teach you anything new?
I saw your blade coming from– Ingeras, run.
Where is your prince now, Dumitru.
I will always watch over you.
You should never have strayed from us.
Get these men off their knees.
Stand up, do you hear me? Stand up!
Prayers will not defend these walls.
Double our sentries on the perimeter walls.
Something I hope to never use again.
I fear this will only inflame the rumors of the prince’s dark magic.
Men cannot fear what they cannot see.
You wanted to pick up your sword and fight.
When my generals blindfolded you, you did not believe that you could march without seeing, but you could.
The vampire is vulnerable to daylight and to pure silver.
Yet the holy cross exerts no power over you.
That can only mean you have yet to seal your fate with human blood.
Let me kill you now, my prince– please– before your people do.
Rumor has spread of what you have become.
You’d do well to run, Lucian.
He is your prince. He has earned the chance to explain.
He was trying to save us all.
Take him to my room and shut the door. Do not let him look outside.
Do you think you are alive because you can fight?
You are alive because of me!
Because of what I did to save you!
This is not who you are.
Believe me, there is still more to fear.
Lord, if you’ve not yet forsaken me, grant me your strength that I may resist the darkness.
Allow me to endure this test one more day.
If you’re sick, I thought it might make you feel better.
You’ll make a great leader someday.
You think of others before yourself.
When the Turks came to take me, you stopped them.
And I would do it all again.
Dawn will be breaking soon, and with it, the loss of my powers.
If we’ve not won this war by then– I will fight beside you until death.
Your death would end my fight.
We have done the duty of any good parent– protected our child, protected all the children in the kingdom.
Perhaps our destiny was not to rule in this life.
Why think separately of this life and the next– When one is born from the last?
Time is always too short for those who need it, but for those who love, it lasts forever.
You can keep running if you like.
I cannot do this without you.
There’s still time for you to stop them.
No. I cannot take your life.
Neither this world or the next shall keep us apart.
I will honor your sacrifice, and I vow that our son shall be safe.
Of all of my lands, this is the one I love the least.
The sun should be risen by now, should it not?
It is the prince. He is coming.
I used to think there were too many of you.
I understand you have a weakness for silver.
Is this the monster that terrified my men? Hmm?
You grow more weary by the moment.
Tell me– how long can you bear it in here, huh?
Long enough to strike your name from the history books.
If I put a stake through your heart– it will kill you– like any other man.
A fitting death for Lord– Impaler.
That is no longer my name.
My name is Dracula– son of the devil.
None. Except for your son, of course.
A distraction we can now dispense with.
Repeated over and over since you were a boy?
All that matters is a prince’s duty to his people.
When he’s gone, you’ll be free.
I don’t want to leave you.
You have to go with him.
Know I will always love you.
Prince Vlad Dracula was a hero, but there are no pictures or statues of him.
His sacrifice taught me that even after the darkest night the sun will rise again.
For if the heart is strong enough, the soul is reborn– with each new day, in life after life, age after age, forever.
Why think separately of this life and the next when one is born from the last?
It speaks to you of yearning, of one soul pleading for another.
